Koch Industries, Inc. All rights reserved.

True charity begins with a chair.

To give all good people a seat at life’s table of opportunity, we help eliminate the barriers that hold them back.

Opening avenues of opportunity.

Our philanthropy is focused on helping people improve their lives through education, mentoring, job skills development and criminal justice reform. One community, one partnership, one person at a time. Here’s how:

We have partnered with Mike Rowe and Project JumpStart to give real-world construction skills to those seeking a second chance.

See how our $25 million grant to UNCF is unleashing a new generation of scholars, innovators and entrepreneurs.

At one private school, our dollars and volunteer hours are helping prepare little ones to do big things.

Meet Jennifer, one of many homeowners building a better life with the help of more than 70,000 volunteer hours and $1.5 million from Koch.

Click here to see more ways we're removing barriers to opportunity.

Supporting our communities.

Our thousands of community partners include:

  • Founded by Charles and Liz Koch, Youth Entrepreneurs helps its students discover their limitless potential and purpose in the workplace and life. We’re proud to support YE and its more than 15,000 graduates.

  • For four decades, Koch – along with hundreds of its employees – has supported the BBBS mission of providing kids with one-on-one, life-changing relationships.

  • As the National Paper Sponsor of the Kids in Need Foundation, Georgia-Pacific is donating a minimum of $365,000 in essential school supplies for children’s education.

  • Since 2006, Georgia-Pacific has given more than $1.75 million in funding and educational assistance to fire departments in the communities where we live and work.

Making it personal.

Beyond our corporate charitable investments, Charles Koch and David Koch have personally given millions of dollars to worthwhile causes. Koch Family Foundations & Philanthropy recipients include cancer research, medical centers and entities dedicated to societal and cultural progress.

Fighting Cancer
Read Story

David H. Koch has pledged $150 million to help build a state-of-the-art outpatient medical facility at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York City. This follows his $686 million in gifts to cancer research and medical facilities across New York City and beyond.

Youth Entrepreneurs

Founded in 1991 by the Charles Koch Foundation, Youth Entrepreneurs provides high school students with values-based entrepreneurial experiences and education that not only instill practical knowledge but also inspire them to prosper.

T-Rex Rules
Read Story

David H. Koch’s $35 million gift to the Smithsonian’s Museum of Natural History is the biggest the museum has ever received. It also is bringing to life our understanding of the most gargantuan creatures ever to walk the planet, including Tyrannosaurus rex.

See the very latest ways we’re changing lives in our communities.

Home

Giving

Food. Shelter. Clothing. Transportation. Koch Industries creates life’s basic necessities, while innovating ways to make them even better. Yet our advocacy for a free and open society is what truly sets us apart.
